body_raw: Today I was playing with this function $$ \sqrt{1-x} $$ and I found that if I try to approximate (near $x=0$) such a function with a polynomial of some order then I can find the same coefficients that WolframAlpha find. Starting with $$ \sqrt{1-x}\sim a_0+a_1x+a_2x^2+a_3x^3+\cdots $$ where $\cdots$ are terms of higher power in $x$, I squared both sides obtaining $$ 1-x\sim a_0^2+a_1^2x^2+a_2^2x^4+a_3^2x^6+2a_0a_1x+2a_0a_2x^2+2a_0a_3x^3+2a_1a_2x^3+2a_1a_3x^4+2a_2a_3x^5+\dots $$ or $$ 1-x\sim a_0^2+2a_0a_1x+(a_1^2+2a_0a_2)x^2+(2a_0a_3+2a_1a_2)x^3+\dots $$ where I choose to ignore terms $x^n$ with $n>3$.
